message: @steve_piercy - nice. Are you sprinting on something? I see you are part of the Lasso group. Lasso takes me back to 98.. how is it these days?

I know a place called Pajaro Dunes a little south of Santa Cruz that has some big places you can rent by the week. Some of these places will sleep 12 people or so. It'd be fun to do some sprints in a beach house instead of a hotel with stiff chairs.

@brianball http://www.vrbo.com/vacation-rentals/usa/california/central-coast/santa-cruz Other beach communities between SC and PD: Live Oak, Capitola, Aptos, La Selva Beach. The drive from Santa Clara is about 30-45 minutes.

@brianball @djdarkbeat OMG! Someone who has *heard* of Lasso! Yes, Lasso lives, has been acquired multiple times: Blueworld -> OmniPilot -> LassoSoft LLC -> Treefrog Interactive. Although the Lasso language has gone through some rough times, the current version is very impressive and very fast. It now has a stable home with sufficient funding to continue, grow and be developed. A new website will be launched in a couple of days with full details http://countdown.lassosoft.com/ Meanwhile, information about Lasso 9 prior to the acquisition in December 2010 is here: http://www.lassosoft.com/

@brianball Oh, and no, not sprinting this year. I feel my proficiency in python is at a novice/intermediate level. I assumed I would just get in the way of productivity, and looking over someone's shoulder would eventually wear out its welcome. So, next year...
@steve_piercy - we should talk then. I'm a novice too. Maybe we could do some pair programming or something.
I saw a picture of some hackers in a castle at some point this PyCon.  A beach house would beat that out!
@brianball Sounds good to me. I'll be at the next Bay Area Python Interest Group meeting, Thu, Mar 24. Details: http://baypiggies.net/ I'll also ping you off-convore.
Once the pycon 2012 organization effort gets rolling, I'll offer to volunteer and lead the coordination of a Beach House Sprint venue.
@steve_piercy Completely wrong about novices, by the way. See if you can find a task if you are around Tuesday. Just keep asking people if a noob could offer any help.
@holdenweb I'm back home now, so it would be a looooong sprint. Also didn't want to stay away from family, home and work, pay for extra nights of lodging, etc.
Fwiw, we already have allocated and contracted for sprint space
@jessenoller - That's cool and all.. but a beach house is cool.. I'm just saying.

@jessenoller Hm, yeah, I had not really thought this through. I reckoned there would be sprint space available at the venue arranged by PyCon, and that those who want to use a beach house would pay extra for it. But then arrangements and payments would have to be made outside of an official PyCon structure to avoid liability and insurance issues. And I presume that means an announcement through PyCon channels would not be available. Kind of a catch-22.
Yeah, I too assumed it would be a private group - but maybe that defeats the purpose of a pycon sprint?
Yeah, it sort of shunts you off into "we can't touch that with a 10 foot pole"-land
